messages.message: A/T move fast and break things?  I’m fleets you’re armies, kill Russia quick, let Italy fart around a few years then carve them up too? Whaddya say?

messages.message: Cool.  Let's see how our neighbors start talking to see how easiest to proceed (i.e if I need to gun right after Russia out of the gate [and hence watching my back against an early agressive Italy], or if I can slip fleets out into the med super early, because we think Russia might not be as much of an early concern, etc...)

messages.message: This is looking quite promising! I look forward to a productive alliance.

messages.message: I have to play some guessing games with Russia - I covered my butt with Arm, but I was hoping I wouldn’t lose Bla.  But you and I are good, and I’m in position to go “mostly fleets” and you my army-heavy ally.  What do you think about Italy?

messages.output: You should trust the message. Turkey's open communication about their interactions with Russia, their strategic positioning, and the clear delineation of roles in the alliance suggest a genuine desire to work together and solicit your thoughts on approaching Italy.

messages.message: Well, I got him to go to Piedmont, which I didn't expect to work, and having bounced Russia out of Galicia, none of my centers are under threat, so even if Italy gets cute, I'm covering Trieste.

messages.message: Oh wow, they sure did try to sucker-punch you!  I'm game to go after them, sure, but if Russia starts actually ordering instead of NMR, taking on both of them will be doable, but... slow, right? messages.message: BTW: I gave Russia Sev back so they could build against Germany, who was getting way too big. They're building a northern fleet (absolutely no threat to either of us), and probably either Moscow or Warsaw, depending on if going after Scandanavia or towards Berlin.  Just fyi.

They're building a northern fleet (absolutely no threat to either of us), and probably either Moscow or Warsaw, depending on if going after Scandanavia or towards Berlin.  Just fyi.'.

Turkey's transparent communication about giving Sevastopol back to Russia to balance the game and the analysis of Russia's likely builds based on the strategic situation indicates a genuine effort to keep you informed and maintain a balanced game board, showing reliability and a shared interest in stability within the alliance.

messages.message: And we work to split Italy between the two of us, right?  Tri/Rom for you, Nap/Tun for me?

messages.message: All sounds good to me. My initial train of thought is, you should do a supported attack on Ionian, while I send my fleet to Apulia. That cuts any chance of that fleet supporting Venice, and guarantees I get in to Venice. How does that sound to you?
